revised_title: Newton's Concept of Inertia and its Relation to Descartes and Lucretius
tldr: This article explores the origins and development of Newton's concept of inertia, tracing its roots to Descartes and Lucretius. The author examines the phrase "quantum in se est" and its significance in understanding Newton's ideas on inertia and the revolutionary new physical thought of the time. The article highlights the connection between motion and rest in the new physics and how this concept was a fundamental departure from traditional Aristotelian physics.
